reviews.review_msg: the worst prof I have ever met across my academic career. he does not know how to teach at all. Taking his class is just a waste of time, but that is mandatory because of the iclicker. and he is unfair on grade. Having a highest mark exceeds the theoretical full mark is just like having rain in Vancouver. Please do try your best to avoid this prof!
Screw this guy, that was a terrible class. 10/10 do avoid at all costs

all he does is basically reread the smart physics again. doesnt help on problems at all, if you dont get the smart physics lectures, youre pretty much dead..he'll scale you in the end, its just that youll probably end up with C+ or B-

the online smartphysics prelecs are just bleh...and all he does in class is a couple of I clicker questions. His exams are waaaaayyy harder than what you'd expect from the smartphysics homework and he doesn't really do anything to prepare you for midterms -,- do NOT take PHYS with him.
He's a funny guy.easy class, easy HW, easy midterms, easey final, easy marks. He made everything easy.  As long as you work on those question, you'll do good.
He is cool. I like the way that he tries to be funny and intertain us...

This course was almost completely taught through the mandatory pre lecture videos that were assigned before each class. The actual lectures were mostly spent going over specific examples and no actual explaining or teaching seemed to happen. Tests were extremely difficult, but they would curve if everyone did poorly.

Lectures were organized and straightforward. She would often do clicker questions and go over examples which was helpful. Tests are far more difficult than the homework and practice tests but she scales marks pretty generously.

DO THE HOMEWORK. Her tests are easy if you do the homework and fully understand it. She loves helping students so go to office hours and I find what she says in office hours is more easy to understand from what she says during lectures. If you can't meet her during her office hours she also answers questions on canvas.
She is very easy to talk to, she will help you with your questions outside of class time, and has many office hours. She is good at explaining problems.
Really hard to sit through lectures, her explanations weren't easy to understand. Midterms and finals are reasonable. def wont take anything with her again if possible.

Dr. Johnson is a really good teacher. There is a lot of HW though, but I think that's every physics class. Just try not to skip lectures, because she uses iclicker polls in class. Course load is pretty heavy though so be prepared. Dr. Johnson is pretty chill though, she'll help with any question you have.

The homework is tough, and do expect to spend hours on a single question, but as long as you like physics it is all good practice (I say this with a 65%). Dr. Johnson gets straight to the point. She has a discussion page where her students can ask her anything and she responds to all of them in a timely manner.
she sounds like she's crying

Her lectures were not helpful, she doesnt engage with the class as much as other profs do. An ungodly amount of homework, and do not miss lectures or tutorials or else you will lose a grade because of iClicker and Tutorial Attendances. Hard to reach outside class and very condescending, Overall, just strengthened my distaste for physics even more.

This class has an unreasonable workload. There are 4 mandatory classes/tutorials to show up to every week. There are 2 prelectures which are not too bad to complete. However every week there are 9-12 assignment questions. They are very difficult and no similar questions to what appears on the assignments are covered in class. Plus a tut question.

First thing to beware is that there is a lot of homework, 12 achieve questions per week along with written homework every other week as well. There are also pre lectures you have to complete which got annoying very fast. Lectures are just ok, she uses iclicker to keep the audience engaged. The exams were pretty difficult but she gives 2 free marks.

Average professor, neither good nor bad. As someone who isn't great at physics, I struggled in her class. However, lectures and examples are useful. Homework is difficult but prepares you well enough for tests.

nothing in the class correlates and rambles during the lecture. Bring a good amount of physics knowledge prior to this class. Everytime you open the homework, the only thing I can think is " when did we ever cover this" . Get good at googling and teaching yourself random concepts she doesn't mention in class. overall mid prof
Very confusing lectures. Reads off of her slides. Tests are nowhere near the practice material provided for it. Tons of homework, I-Clicker is necessary. Take this class with someone else.

Physics is my worst subject (barely a C in phys100) but he teaches it very clear and well. Lots of examples and demos done in class and he explains the concepts good. Replies to emails fast and will give bonus marks to boost the midterm marks if needed. His tests are fair and there are no trick questions. HW./tutorial/MasteringP are very helpful
I thought I'd die after midterm-1, but this course turned out much better than I thought!! Chill..

While i thought he did a good job helping out students and caring for us in the course, he and erol basically taught off of the smartphysics slides and did next to no teaching of their own. I found myself constantly learning from online sources and the textbook, i think that they should abandon smartphysics altogether.  Good class overall
Great Prof altogether! Very thorough and accessible! Exam was tough, but class gets scaled. Hope to have him again in the future!
easy course
He is good. I managed to get good grade on fair final. Also Marco is great guy.
Bernd is good prof.
pretty good class. Exams are hard, midterms are ok.
Yeah! My best course this year.

Great Prof altogether! This is the first time I felt like I was taken care of at SFU. He is doing lots of experiments in class to explain concepts. The rest is practice, which I did myself happily, knowing I would not be screwed over in the end. Very good experience!
awesome prof he's just so loveable. doesn't teach very well so I learned the whole course material on my own but scales very well

Bernd is a great guy, VERY interested in what he teaches, the only negative that comes from his lectures is that he skims over how to get to equations, not exactly how to use them, and he also tends to move his mouth away from his microphone at times. That is all. Ze force on ze horse. german ja.
really nice guy. his class is fun cuz he does experiments. but he goes over the power point too fast and mumbles sometimes so u cant really understand him. so read the book.midterms r easy.
Powerpoint lectures, sometimes a bit fast. Lot's of experiments during lectures (fun!). Really nice guy! Enjoyed the ride!
Nice guy!, However, The lectures are all powerpoints from the textbook, hard to understand the material. Make sure to get the textbook and study it.
Good lecturer, do not have to read the book! lol...

I failed phys 120 with sonier, but when i took it with stelzer, he made me feel i can do the material. You see a big difference between him and sonier. Just read the textbook and review the homework to do well on his midterms and finals
I also took that class last fall but failed badly. Now I feel I can do it. I think he is good Prof!
Great attitude! Likes doing practical examples.
O M G! QUIZZES are so damn hard. and his lectures are totally useless just like reading a textbook? It can be forgiven by easy exams

Lecture is very boring and useless... Feels like your money is wasted having to take this class. It also seems like he doesn't know what he is doing at all! Overall he is a good guy and is trying hard.

Struggles to explain anything during lecture, also do not sit in the first few roads his breath smells awful. Somebody tell this physics prof to go brush his teeth my god it smells like the worst ðŸ¤¢

Took it last semester, failed both midterms and studied like my life depended on it only to clutch the final everyone failed, other classes feel easy now. This man will help you dig deep into the abyss that is your soul to find potential that hasn't seen the light of day, whether you like it or not.

The lectures were very hit or miss. He often did useful demos to explain topics but otherwise, his explanations were lacklustre and he often used calc 2 concepts even though calc 1 is the corequisite for this course. Both midterms were very fair but the final was brutal with a failing average.

Took this course as an elective, and while it was a ton of work it was one of the most rewarding classes I have taken yet. Exams are hard but as they should be for this type of class, nothing on them will hit you out of left field, your grade in this class is a direct representation of how hard you work. Matthias' lectures are solid and enjoyable.

Exams are difficult but they are not unfair. If you study and really understand the material fully you should be able to do well. The average was very low but I don't think this course was unfair at all. He cares about students and does fun live demos and does his best to keep lectures interesting. Study by doing lots of practice problems.

Really not as bad as people make him out to be. His lectures are pretty basic compared to the tutorial questions and homework so I recommend doing practice problems. Midterms were fine and fair, but the final was pretty hard (mostly due to it being focused on rotation, which I personally found difficult). Overall, ignore the bad reviews

These reviews are way to harsh. Dr. Danninger is chill and kind dude who wants the best for his students. His Midterms and Finals were fair (I found the midterms to be harder than the finals). As long as you study for them you will get a good grade. Make sure to go to the tutorials as they are very helpful

PHYS120 taught by Danninger is probably one of the easiest physics courses that you can take compared to 101 or 125. The lectures were a bit hard to follow excluding the practical demonstrations.
If you know your stuff and want to get a good grade, this "criminal of a professor" has got your back.

He's a nice prof to be honest. His test from midterm 1 should be what you expect from his difficulty, I would recommend to study off your tutorials instead of homework from achieve (not enough hard question to be on a test) . Tutorial actually requires you to use lectures materials that he teaches, achieve homework can be done with phys 12 ways.

Ignore the other reviews, Danninger is awesome. He makes lectures interesting with lots of random cool demos, and he always covers everything needed in lectures. Although sometimes his lectures can seem overcomplicated, it's because he is showing you the proofs for each equation, instead of just saying them. 100% would take another class.

Dr. Danninger has no consideration for his students it is appalling. Avoid this criminal of a prof. His exams are beyond what should be considered fair for first-year students. Exam averages in the 30s should not be allowed! Take a class with a professor other than Stupid Danninger.

worst physics professor ive ever met. seems to want to fail every single student but cant because he has to let some students pass to avoid suspicion. his exams are so unfair your gonna need to study you azz off if you wanna even have a chance at passing. he also scaled our class up, so i got a D with 55. utterly wicked professor.

avoid dr danninger. his lectures are so bland and cover extremely little content so you basically have to learn how to do all the practice problems yourself. the exams danninger gives are also way too unfair its ridiculous.

danninger gave super easy midterms and then killed everyone on the final. avoid danninger; and if you have him, dont let the midterms give you a false sense of security. he gave the most brutal final and everyone was super unprepared for it. there were no practice questions given even remotely similar to the questions on the final exam!

Dr. Danninger seems to be unaware of what he is doing most of the time. Consistently late to lectures, and consistently goes over time. The worst combination. He also gives extremely easy homework questions, so people are confident until he gives an absolutely brutal final exam that had a 40 percent average. He needs to get his head together.

Might be the worst prof I've ever had in terms of organization. His classes are terribly structured and he is super slow at responding to emails. He also made the exams significantly harder than any of the practice problems we were given. He seems like a nice guy, but he is terrible at teaching and organizing.

in lectures he goes over extremely simple examples but the tutorials and homeworks are near-impossible without TA help. and then the final exam was the hardest exam ive ever seen. every question was extremely complicated. he said that the final was on all of phys 120 but in reality, the final was only on stuff at the end of the course. he lied!

Professor Danninger is great! I'm not even the best at physics, but he really helps and takes the pre-lecture feedback seriously. There are multiple course components, so if you're weaker in one area, another will equalize it. For our year, he would drop your lowest mid-term if your final was better

Avoid Danninger. He gives extremely unreasonable exams its ridiculous. Before the midterm exam, he said he was too lazy to create practice review problems. So nobody knew what to expect. It turns out that every single question was literally impossible and we only had 50 minutes to write it.

avoid danninger at all costs. this prof cannot properly organize and run a class. his lectures are always super slow and boring. he fails to organize proper examples and teaches the bare minimum of concepts. the hw questions are super tough that nobody can do them its ridiculous. maybe if he taught better, the hw would be easier. avoid danninger!
danninger is the best prof ever! his cute puppy always shows up in lectures making it the best class ever! his classes are always enjoyable with his cute puppy around!
best physics prof at sfu. i wish he taught more upper level classes cuz im gonna miss him.

Matthias Danninger is the worst physics prof ever. He gives out so much hard homework and doesn't teach anything similar to the homework in his lectures. His dog always barks during lectures so he always has to delay and never finishes lectures on time and always has to skip material. no wonder the whole class has no idea how to do any of the hw!

his lectures contain so many slides that he can never finish them before class is over so he always has to skip sections or continue in the next class. lectures are never at the same pace as when assignments are due so we are always forced to finish the homework and tutorial assignments without proper knowledge. okay at teaching, bad organizer.

Please avoid Dr. Danninger, he isn't the worst professor in the world but he's close to it. He explains concepts very quick and also skips important concepts that appear on exams. He always says that students should do the practice problems but never explains how to do the practice problems. You're really left to learn on your own with Danninger.

Dr. Danninger is such a terrible prof. His lectures super boring and he always goes over time. He never explains anything thoroughly and often refuses to answer student's questions. The homework given in the course barely correlates with what he covers in the lectures. Do not take a class with him because he will ruin your physics experience!

AVOID. the only good thing about Matthias Danninger is he shows cool experiments. Otherwise, his lectures are super boring and he always goes over time. Whenever he explains anything, he goes super quick and often skips steps so you cannot keep up... All the homework and exams are super challenging while all his examples in lectures are super easy.

Dr. Danninger is a pretty average professor in my opinion. His lectures are straight-forward and to the point. Not the best at explaining things, but not terrible either. He seems like a nice guy overall. Main downside is that he tends to go a bit over time every class which can be a bit annoying if you have a class right after.

His classes may be long and occasionally dull, but Dr. Danninger makes up for it. He is great at listening to feedback from the Sapling pre lectures, and from the feedback he comes up with his lectures, which are usually full of examples to help practice. The material may be somewhat hard, but he helps you out so it which is very enjoyable.

Truly a great professor! Physics is a very difficult subject (for me at least), but this prof made it a lot easier to approach the material. He explains things very well and seems like a nice guy. One thing I really enjoyed were the little experiments he set up in his home to show us at the end of lectures (made things fun)!
He's a helpful teacher, gives lots example in the lecture and try to let u understand the concept.

Very nice man, very flexible with due dates, tests are pretty fair,however the course seemed very scrambled to me, lectures were not very engaging learned everything myself. It was his first time teaching phys100 but for me personally it was just hard to follow his teaching style and all the course information just felt scrambled around in my head.

He's a genuinely funny and kind person. However, he doesn't teach clearly. Get ready to teach urself most of the topics covered and then do exceeding level Q's on exams. He expects u to know a lot already and explains concepts using calculus notations from MATH151. If ur not already well versed in basic concepts in phys and calc, get a diff prof.

Erol's lecture will often have you laughing but unfortunately he doesn't teach the content very well. It is difficult to understand what he says and his writing isn't very legible either. Erol does truly care for his students but that attitude isn't reflected in his lectures as it seems that not much effort has gone into the presentation.

If you have trouble with accents. /RUN/. The course would have been a lot easier had I understood what he was saying half of the time. Additionally, he spoke with broken English. Definitely go to TA hours if you want to pass.

Has thick accent, and mumbles on top of this so very difficult to understand. Homework is easy, tests are really hard. Lectures are useless because he derives formulae and thats it, and you never have to do this on tests. Homework due dates were changed constantly, and sometimes homework was due two lectures before we would talk about the topic.
What makes things more fun is the fact that he is Bucky Barnes in the avengers. He skipped filming to teach class, and that shows his commitment to the students

Erol means well, but I really didn't learn in his lectures. Reading the pre-lectures gave me confidence in knowing the material, but then he would blow that confidence out of the water with overcomplicated solutions (so much so that he kept messing up during review for the final). Mastering the tutorial questions is necessary to get a stellar mark.
Explains concepts very poorly and is not entirely knowledgeable on the subjects he teaches. Puts very little effort into lecture slides.
I found his tests relatively easy so long as you were comfortable solving the questions given on tutorials.

He does a lot of complicated proofs of formulas during class, which is nice for those that enjoy physics, though not essential, since they are not on the exam.  His lectures are decent, though his main strength is his willingness to provide extra help after class. I wish every professor could be so easy to reach after class.
Hard to understand what he's saying because of his accent. The tests scale went from Midterm 1- easy Midterm2 - easy Final- Super super super hard.
Midterms are quite easy so long as you practice the assigned work.  Tutorials are well structured and provide all the relevant material for the exams.

He's alright. Typical academic in  the fact that lectures are pointless and full of overcomplicated baloney. He differs from other academics however, in the fact that his tests are pretty fair. I zoned out and played on my phone during class (went for iclicker) and aced the course just by doing my own thing

Awesome guy, English is not his first language, so lectures do get a bit confusing sometimes, but is more than happy to help you during office hours. It seems like he really tries hard to help everyone pass as much as he can.
He talks with an accent but is really helpful and nice guy.
No Comments
Boring, repetitive, and rather unorganized . . . his tests also killed.
Really nice person inside & outside classroom. Enthusiastic about his subject & tries to explain things as clear as possible. makes physics fun & easy!
Refreshingly enthusiastic!  Actually wants to teach!
Excellent entusiasm, great office hours, nice to see a prof that cares!
excellent office hours... enthusiastic... great... you learn lots from him!
No Comments
Very fun prof...super easy midterms...incredibly unfair hardcore final...
funny, not boring at all, easy midterms but killer exams ( real killer exam !! )
This prof loves what he teaches.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
By far my favourite prof!!  I want to be a physicist now too!

It's clear that Jeff rather be doing anything else than teaching. He does not really care about his students and will make no extra effort to help you out. Jeff is condescending and rude when answering questions , as well as generally unprofessional. Tests are also fairly hard. Avoid if possible.

The test problems given are significantly more difficult and 2 steps up from all the practice that we've been given through Sapling, the textbook, and lecture content. The lectures themselves are monotone and he does not clearly answer students questions. I'd rather have waited a semester to take this course with a different professor.

Jeff sonier is hands down an AWFUL professor. He overcomplicates the material and involves way too complicated formulas or explanations for easier (not extremely easy) concepts. Phys 120 is hard yet he makes it 1000x harder. Dont bother asking questions, youll get a sassy response. Worst professor, take these reviews seriously.

Jeff Sonier is an awful professor. The man obviously knows what he is talking about but cannot communicate the material with the class. Physics 120 Is hard yet he makes it even harder. He is immature and sassy to his students when they ask questions and his exams are impossible. Youll need luck just getting a 60 on the exams.
Impolite, cannot teach well.

He was extremely rude and unprofessional. He lacks communication ability with the students, and he doesn't have the enthusiasm while teaching (its like he is being forced). Also, his exams are extremely hard, with connections and ideas that we have NOT covered in class. I would certainly not take this class with him again if I fail.
Lots of "um" in lectures, this prof cant teach. Over confuses concepts and everything can be learnt online from the prelecture homework videos.

He didn't give notes or practice exams. He said there was no need for a textbook. Everything was from smart physics which was not sufficient. The TA was more useful and helpful than him. Don't take a class with him if you love your GPA.
Very bad professor! his lectures are useless and he is not willing to help you in his office hour, if you can even find him. just do not take any course with him.
avoid him please.

Worst professor you will ever have at SFU. He is horrendous at explaining things and his lectures are useless. Don't even bother going because attendance is not mandatory. Just teach yourself. Also, his exams are impossible. Good Luck!
Just terrible and condescending,
He is very nice guy that tries his best to make sure you learn the material. He make the class easier to help the students do better. The level of difficultly for his tests are intermediate.
The way he explain the problem is quite confusing for people who don't understand the topic very well. He's a nice guy, but I just wish he can make his explanation easier.

Useless professor. Relies solely on smartphysics and practice midterms are useless as well. The TA'S do a better job at teaching his class than he does. If you can avoid his class, do so at all costs.

NEVER TAKE HIS CLASS, useless teacher. all he does is stand and clicks his slides and confuses the students. gives no resources to practice problems with. He relies on a website to give students "Pre-lectures" which are completely useless.
Make things complicate. Make us attend his class. Test and Quizzes are hard. Relys on smartphysics too much. Not enough practice for us. Ignore our questions, does not answer emails.
the worst person and teacher.

He is the worst teacher I have ever seen. class note is useless and his explanation make concepts more confusing. He is not approachable and does not answer any question outside the class. He is very good to make easy concepts confusing. I didn't learn anything from his class. Stay away from him and do not take any course with this guy.

Great professor. He explains the concepts clearly and emphasizes the proper way to learn physics. He does a good job teaching to a large class with a diverse range of interest in physics. Would certainly take another course from him.

Awful prof- makes easy concepts ridiculously and unnecessarily complicated. Also very unhelpful- doesn't have office hours and doesn't actually answer questions if you ask. Made me hate a subject I loved.
Classes are boring as hell.. Doesn't teach his own stuff, found midterms really hard, but final was fairly easy
He's an extremely mean person and terrible at teaching. Exams are stupidly easy tho. Easy A+
hes is a bad prof the course is really easy forces people to attend lecture with iclick and makes tutorial manditory for marks. doesnt even have his own lecture material takes it from smartphyiscs
He is so mean.

He is overall an okay person; however, not really good at clarifying the materials taught in the class. The textbook, SmartPhysics, is a pain to use since there are no actual solutions for it. Even though you can find solutions online (Yahoo Answers), some of them are incorrect and can lead to more misunderstanding.

He is a useless teacher. His lectures are boring and he has no idea how to control the class. He says he is available for extra help, but he really isn't. Students are too scared to approach him because when someone asks a question online he calls that students stupid, essentially. Not a respectful teacher and doesn't deserve our respect.

Just terrible. Very condescending, does not explain concepts well and the textbook used is not very useful. Survived easily with Physics 12 notes from highschool. Only good thing about him is that he is respectful to the learning environment

My GOD!! where to start?? if you can go to any other physics course then, DO IT!! the only reason I'm writing this is because i wouldn't even wish for my enemy to be stuck with him. really if i knew i had one hour to live, id spend it in his class cause it lasts for Freaking eternity!!!!! PS: his TAs suck too!! and the tutorials are useless!

I learned nothing more from him teaching than I did from grade ten physics. This class is a breeze, but you really only need to go to class for smart physics questions, the rest there is no point in being there.

Absolutely the worst prof ever. Doesn't help his students and post up the most useless in class lecture notes ever. If you don't attend his class, he doesn't post them online so what is the use? Avoid this prof!

Class notes are really useless. I did my homework by using phys 11 and 12 notes. He makes simple concepts harder then they actually seem. If you reread your phys 11 and 12 notes then you will do well on the midterms and finals.

Good prof. The course is just physics 12 basically so if you know that stuff you WILL get an A in this class. The midterms are easy. He can sometimes be boring though. I don't take notes in class but his examples are well chosen and reflect what will be on the tests. He also posts previous midterms online which are very helpful.
He's an alright person and the class is fair. Do your homework and remember you physics 11/12 and you will do great. Teaches random stuff which is not even on final.

actually this course is useless.sfu just want to rob $.we learnt all that stuff in high school. the only new thing is special relativity.you learn that and you are invincible at the final. jeff doesnt explain properly,sometimes i dont even know wat hes talking about.reading the text will help.(ps:i dont go to lecture)I got A-,thanks to physics11/12
avoid him. he is the worst professor in my life. his attitude is very rude and his lecture note is useless. Assignments are very hard and exam is not fair.
Him+mastering physics+homework+midterms+final=destruction
**** YOU

Horrible prof. He has one way of explaining concepts and if you ask him to clarify something he just repeats exactly what he said. He is not helpful in office hours. Homework was impossible. I used to like physics, and now I hate it. :'(

EXTREMELY NOT HELPFUL! Horrible course, annoying online assignments,which he usually "BUSY" not in OHs to help, even he's there, you are just too "SMART" he doesnt want to teach you. Do not take his course or you will regret, take another professor!!

He is the worse person/prof I have ever seen. He is not even knowledgeable for the course he is teaching. He has sever attitude problem and is very condescending person. He skips hard concepts but when it comes to simple things he explains as if he is a noble prize winner and no one else can understand it. STAY AWAY FROM HIM, YOU ARE SAFE.
Terrible at explaining, and is always in a bad mood, is condescneding to his students.  Doesn't encourage questions or office hours.

I had him as my 1st physics prof when i first started in sfu, shoulda listened to my friend when he said he was horrible. notes suck, he goes super fast even though he said he'll go @ a slow pace. he's also got bad attitude.he also made simple integrals look hard for those who has forgotten/never used them.
he cant teach at alllll
Useless, doesnt teach concepts, and confuses the hell out of stuff you already know.  Midterms arent bad, final was hard.
Not the nicest prof out there, never seems to be in a really good mood. Exams aren't very difficult. Refuses to post notes or past exams.

His lectures were boring and he's not very approachable but his tests are really easy.  Pay attention, although it's difficult with him, and you'll be fine.  As far as his teaching goes, he should start focusing on concepts more.  It would help more in the long run.
This guy was terrible, I don't know why he's allowed to teach, he has no interest in his students whatsoever and he is a very condescending man.
he's a really bad professor. i went up to ask him question, but he didn't reply me... its funny how i got higher on the midterm when i didn't study... he has attitude problems. avoid him

If you fail his class it's your fault. This prof is the best I've seen, considering he is teaching physics. Bell curves are useless. If you study, truly study you will be fine. The material is very basic mostly physics 12 stuff. I don't know how anyone can fail his class.

Lecture notes make everything look simple, but assignments/exams are way more intense. Although he has a dry sense of humor, tends to mock most of the obnoxious kids trying to be funny in his class... yet they don't pick up on it hahah
very bad at teaching
this guy should find himself a new job, he treats the class like dumb ppl, plus hes not approachable!

He is a very nice person and specially helpful when u go to his office. Fair assignments and easy exams. I cant believe anyone call him a bad prof. I think if a student doesn't like him, that's probably because they don't study enough or they are just aren't good at physics.

I used to believe physics is very easy and intersting but not anymore now. I just hate it now. Probably because I am the only BUS students there. I feel he is just another SCIENCE prof. faceless and no emotion at all. Boring lecture which he keeps talking and writting down note the whole class while half the seats are empty.

he's a nice guy. his notes are neat. but its more about the textbook. he knows what he's doing, but not so much how to teach. .. cant help but feel bad when half his class is empty. if you get your physics, then you're good to go. if you dont, then .. lol
No Comments
Horrible exams, but scaled. So it's possible to fail one of the MTs and the final and get a B. (I guess)
smiley. cute. super helpful. cares about students. it's worth getting up in the morning for his class even though it's a first year one.  way to go hayden!
what are you whiny people talking about? he is the one of the best profs i've ever had.  always smiling, always willing to help.
Should be teaching high-school English.
great proff! very knowledgeable and interresting. people should stop complaining about the fact that everyone miserably failed (most got like 20% before scaling) but then again i nailed it.
he sucks! worst class i've ever taken. his exams are way too hard.

Horrible prof., shouldn't be teaching.  Comes up with the most bizzar questions for tests, and gives ABSOLUTELY no prep.-no samples, and gives extremely simplified examples in class.  Avoid him at all cost...I know less now than i knew entering the class.
AMAZING prof.  really really cares about his students, great lecturer, knows material extremely well.  deserves a teaching award

Although it may not seem like it at first, the class is straighforward and simple. The only new material you learn is in the first 1/3. The rest is all review (using calculus on grade 11/12 material). The prof's organized and scales the tests :)

Very graceful and energetic. doesn't he remind you of jack from will and grace? He is so helpful when you actually talk to him and so very friendly and welcoming. the organization is amazing. keep up the good work
No Comments
No Comments

very smart, super nice. Excellent enthusiasm and yes, makes physics really interesting! Seems to know everything and can explain it too. Not easy for an average-brainer but still a fantastic teacher, both in knowledge and personality.
Nice prof!!
fantastic prof!  made physics fun.  very approachable... cares about his students
Very good nature, actually enjoys teaching!..deserved better marks
the BEST prof i've ever had - made me want to major in physics
Although his test are super hard, you can really learn from him.Phys can be fun!
very willing to help students. high class avg
Very cheerful but hard midterms avg 50%
Mediocre textbooks, but excellent lectures.  Also easy to get in touch with
midterms aren't unfair, they just require you actually understand the material.
He spends too much time on the easy stuff and brushes over the hard stuff
No Comments
good prof
No Comments
